What is the hourly rate cap for child ca.answer: Families earning $68,163 pa or less will receive a subsidy of 85% of their child care fees up to the rate cap of $11.98 per hour. For families earning between $68,163 to under $173,163 pa, the subsidy gradually tapers down from 85% to 50%, receiving 1% less for every $3000.

Is the child care rebate means tested?.answer: How much does family day care cost? Fees for family day care vary according to location, the educator's qualifications, the hours of care, and the age of the child. However, the typical fee range is $7-$10 per hour. Some educators provide food, nappies and transport, and these costs will be added to the hourly rates.

Is there a cap on child care subsidy?.answer: Families earning $186,958 or less per year are not subject to a cap on the amount of Child Care Subsidy they can access. Families earning over $186,958 and under $351,248 have an annual cap of $10,190 per year per child.
